Key Match Events: Adam Zampa took 4 wickets in the match
Australia lost the toss and struggled to contain Kusal Perera (78) and Pathum Nissanka (61) during a 125-run opening partnership
David Warner and Steve Smith fell in the same Dilshan Madushanka over
Mitch Marsh (52 from 51 balls) recaptured his pre-World Cup form
Josh Inglis scored a career-best ODI knock of 58 from 59 balls
Glenn Maxwell had a furious cameo late in the match
Australia reached the target in the 36th over
Post-Match Reflections: Adam Zampa played through back spasms during the match
Zampa said he could be doing better but was happy with the result
Sri Lanka has now lost its first three matches, facing an uphill battle to make it past the pool stage
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wild wind in Lucknow blew banners down from the roof of the stadium and into the crowd, delaying the start of the second innings
Others: The win in Lucknow gives Australia some room to move after they dropped their first two matches and risked crashing out of contention for the knockout stage with another loss
Criticised for his form to begin the tournament, Zampa said he still had room for improvement once he returned to peak physical condition
